alert.note: Alert for Cayuga; Cortland; Madison; Oneida; Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 10:17AM EST until January 14 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Oneida County in central New York... Western Madison County in central New York... Southeastern Cayuga County in central New York... Northern Cortland County in central New York... Southeastern Onondaga County in central New York... * Until 1045 AM EST. * At 1017 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Lee to near Sempronius, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Rome, Sullivan, Oneida, Lenox, Pompey, Lee, Verona, Westmoreland, Vienna, and Chittenango. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 32 and 34. New York Interstate 81 between 13 and 15, and near 16. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
